name: End Account
description: Closes and finalizes a patient account when billing activities are complete or no longer needed
hl7Reference: HL7 v2.3 Chapter 6 Financial Management - HL7.eu/HL7v2x/v23/std23
businessPurpose: Formally close patient accounts that have completed billing cycles or are no longer needed for financial processing
timing: Sent when account has zero balance, all billing is complete, or account needs to be closed for administrative reasons
standardNotes: P06 closes accounts but preserves historical billing data
Use after all financial transactions have been completed and reconciled
Account closure should follow organizational data retention policies
EVN.2 should contain the account closure date/time
Different from P02 (purge) which removes account data entirely
Closed accounts typically remain in system for historical reporting
realWorldScenarios: Patient account has zero balance after final insurance payment
Long-term care patient discharged with all billing resolved
Self-pay account fully paid and ready for closure
Deceased patient account closed after estate settlement complete
Clinical trial account closure after study completion and final billing
Worker's compensation case closed after claim resolution

generationRules.PID: Patient identification for account being closed
generationRules.PV1: Visit information if account closure relates to specific encounter
generationRules.GT1: Final guarantor information for account closure
generationRules.requiredDataQuality: Critical - account closure affects financial reporting and audit compliance
